meanings.definition: Mixed up in a confused or disordered way.
meanings.sent1: The jumbled puzzle pieces made it hard to complete the picture.
meanings.sent2: The jumbled books on the shelf needed to be organized.
meanings.sent3: The jumbled mess of toys on the floor looked like a tornado had passed through.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as jumbled as a tangled ball of yarn.
meanings.sent5: The jumbled colors of the painting created a chaotic yet intriguing masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To mix in a confused or disordered way.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally jumbled the ingredients while baking the cake.
meanings.sent2: Please do not jumbled the files on my desk.
meanings.sent3: The chef jumbled the recipe and ended up with a strange dish.
meanings.sent4: The wind jumbled the leaves into a colorful pile on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The children jumbled the blocks together to build a unique structure.
